text: hey guys today I want to talk to you
about traveler's diarrhea because I have
a bad case of it I'm not shy to talk
about it with you guys because it's a
common thing it's normal it happens to a
lot of travelers and right now I'm
currently in Yemen as you can hear the
prayers happening right now it's four
o'clock prayers so I think I don't know
what it is that I ate a couple days ago
maybe one of those spicy potato things
that you dip the bread in or maybe it
was a salad because the vegetables were
washed but it doesn't really matter what
it is the fact of the matter is my
stomach is erect and it makes traveling
not fun at all especially when you're
using toilets that are holes in the
ground with all over the floors
especially windows never in a toilet
paper or anything and when the shower is
usually just a little bowl of water
coming out it's rough to travel in Yemen
in general but having diarrhea makes it
about 10 times more rough so I just want
to address the fact if you guys all of
you guys probably get it and you
probably don't know what to do so what I
do is I usually drink a lot of water
everybody says I think a lot of water
but really drink three times the amount
that you normally drink so today I've
already had seven bottles of water and
you can see how sweaty it is by the way
there the electricity is out in this
hotel room right now and which means the
a/c is broken and the fan doesn't work
so I'm just sitting here baking in my
sweat as I'm talking to you guys
so I drink a lot of water and then
remember BRB bread rice and bananas
those three things I pretty much stick
to and I've exclusively eaten those
three things over the last 48 hours and
slowly my stomach is getting better and
better
so water bread rice and bananas I like
to stay away from medication when I take
imodium if the opposite happens and I
get really blocked up and then I can't
use the bathroom for like a week and
then that's even worse almost so it's
better to just let your body naturally
get rid of what it needs to get rid of
but if you really really are stuck and
it's really bad and you can't do
anything then as a last resort you can
take cyber off low axon or
justise I prefer short I carry it with
me is just big pills that you take and
it completely fixes it it's like a
miracle drug but apparently it's not
really good for your insides and there's
some bad side effects with it so you
don't want to do it much but I would
recommend carrying its eye pro with you
and taking it if need be right now I'm
not taking it because I think it's just
gonna go away I get food poisoning about
once every month let's say so it's quite
normal for me but for people that don't
get it very much I hope do you find this
video useful and the ways that you can
prevent food poisoning is always always
always doing bottled water I brush my
teeth with bottled water honestly it
depends what country you're in of course
but most of the time if you want to
prevent it avoid any kind of drinking
water tap water that served at the
restaurants and then if you eat fruits
and vegetables make sure that you peel
it yourself like you open it cuz
otherwise they probably don't clean it
out very well and then I would
personally avoid street food and really
oily food unless you have a strong
stomach go for it but if you really want
to prevent it on the road then you can
stick to restaurants with a clean
kitchen but that's not really common in
Yemen so Yemen is probably the roughest
travel conditions that I've ever
experienced that includes all the places
I've been in Africa that includes the
rest of the Middle East in the Gulf
countries and Asia and Europe and South
America North America or whatever it's
really extreme traveling I don't
recommend it for the average traveler
but if you really want some real life
down nitty-gritty experiences then come
here and honestly speaking this country
is amazing looking past all the war
looking past the politics looking past
the food poisoning I've been welcomed
with nothing but smiles I've been
invited into homes for some food I've
been enjoying the Magnificent nature and
World Heritage Sites all over Yemen so
okay I am gonna go use the bathroom and
create talking to you guys comment below
if you have any suggestions about
traveler's diarrhea if you have it or
how to prevent it without to hear from
you alright see you later
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my

join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
